subject: Automobile Racing
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Hélio Castroneves is being replaced on Team Penske by the Australian driver Will Power — at least until Castroneves’s tax evasion trial is resolved. Castroneves, a two-time Indianapolis 500 winner, has pleaded not guilty to charges of conspiracy and tax evasion involving about $5.5 million in income stashed in offshore accounts. He is scheduled to go to trial in Miami on March 2, just over a month before the IndyCar season begins. Tim Cindric, the president of Team Penske, said Power, a former Champ Car star, would handle the winter testing for the car assigned to Castroneves and be ready, if necessary, to race. ¶Hall of Fame Racing became the latest Nascar team to use a merger to stave off collapse, aligning with Yates Racing to keep its operation running into the new season. Hall of Fame ended its technical alliance with Joe Gibbs Racing at the end of last season, then laid off most of its workers last month as sponsorship difficulties put its 2009 schedule in doubt. The building that the team leased was also put up for sale. Under the new alignment, Hall of Fame’s No. 96 will switch to Ford and operate out of Yates’s recently expanded facility. No driver was chosen for the No. 96, which used multiple drivers last season after J. J. Yeley was fired midway through the year. merge.
